org.openremote.java.console.controller.connector

Class AndroidHttpConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openremote.java.console.controller.connector.AndroidHttpConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControllerConnector

    public class AndroidHttpConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Android specific connector capable of calling callback on the UI thread via the Android Looper Handler
    Author:
    Richard Turner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AndroidHttpConnector() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback, int timeout)
      Connects to the controller and maintains the connection; it is the connectors responsibility to notify the caller via the callback onFailure method when the connection closes for some reason
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the controller; does nothing if not already connected
      java.net.URL getControllerUrl()
      Gets the controller URL
      Credentials getCredentials()
      Returns the currently active credentials
      void getPanel(java.lang.String panelName, AsyncControllerCallback<Panel> callback, int timeout)
      Returns org.openremote.web.console.panel.Panel definition of the specified panel.
      void getPanelInfo(AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.List<PanelInfo>> callback, int timeout)
      Returns java.util.List of panels that are recognised by this controller.
      void getResource(ResourceLocator resourceLocator, java.lang.String resourceName, boolean getData, AsyncControllerCallback<ResourceInfo> callback, int timeout)
      Get the resource info for the requested resource optionally retrieve the data of the resource (otherwise lazy load)
      void getResourceData(java.lang.String resourceName, AsyncControllerCallback<ResourceDataResponse> callback, int timeout)
      Get the data for the requested resource
      void getSensorValues(int[] sensorIds, AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback, int timeout)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values.
      boolean isConnected()
      Indicates if the connector is currently connected to the controller
      void logout(AsyncControllerCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback, int timeout)
      Logs out of the controller.
      void monitorSensors(int[] sensorIds, AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback, int timeout)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values only for sensors whose values have changed since the last request.
      void sendCommand(PanelCommand command, AsyncControllerCallback<PanelCommandResponse> callback, int timeout)
      Returns Boolean indicating whether command send request was successful.
      void setControllerUrl(java.net.URL controllerUrl)
      Sets the controller URL
      void setCredentials(Credentials credentials)
      Sets the org.openremote.java.controller.auth.Credentials to be used by this connector
